data.name: HalfSynchronizedDescription
data.value: All Member of a class should synchronize the same invocations.

data.name: FireAndForgetAnalyzerDescription
data.value: In almost all cases Fire and Forget Calls should'nt take place.

data.name: HalfSynchronizedAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: The {0} {1} is also used in another synchronized Method . Consider synchronizing also this one.

data.name: FireAndForgetAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: The result of this Computation is potentially never awaited

data.name: UnsynchronizedPropertyAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: The Property is used in a synchronized Member. Consider synchronizing it.

data.name: HalfSynchronizedTitle
data.value: Synchronization should be absolute.

data.name: FireAndForgetAnalyzerTitle
data.value: A Computation in a seperate Thread is not awaited

data.name: ETCAnalyzerDescription
data.value: Threads should be replaced with Task

data.name: ETCAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Threads should be replaced with Task

data.name: ETCAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Threads shouldn't be used

data.name: NSMCAnalyzerDescription
data.value: No deadlocks should occur in code

data.name: NSMCAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Possible deadlock with double locking

data.name: NSMCAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Nested synchronized method calls

data.name: MWSAnalyzerDescription
data.value: Starvation could happen

data.name: MWSIfAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: if should be replaced with while

data.name: MWSAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Wrong monitor usage

data.name: MWSPulseAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Pulse should be replaced with PulseAll

data.name: TapirAnalyzerDescription
data.value: Tapirs shouldn't be alone

data.name: TapirAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Tapir Class is lonely

data.name: TapirAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Tapir :)

data.name: OAAnalyzerDescription
data.value: Wrong or complicated usage of async

data.name: OAAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: async shouldn't be used in private methods

data.name: OAAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Wrong or complicated usage of async

data.name: OAAnalyzerMessageFormatNestedAsync
data.value: Async shoudn't be nested {0} times

data.name: PSAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Primitive Synchronization

data.name: PSAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Consider using more abstract constructs like lock if not implementing a high performant library.

data.name: PSAnalyzerDescription
data.value: The Synchronization Mechanicms used are very primitive. Consider using a higher form of abstraction.

data.name: TRRAnalyzerDescription
data.value: Timeouts can lead to starvation

data.name: TRRAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Timeouts can lead to starvation

data.name: TRRAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Starvation possible

data.name: FSAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Unsynchronized Finalizers

data.name: FinalizerSynchronizationAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: This Member is used within the class and its Finalizer. Consider Synchronizing the usages.

data.name: FSAnalyzerDescription
data.value: Finalizers run asynchronous to the rest of the code. Access to Members in Finalizers should therefore be synchronized.

data.name: WCTAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Waiting Conditions between Tasks

data.name: WCTAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: This Tasks uses Synchronization Mechanisms. Be sure to not introduce Deadlocks or similiar hazards when working with multiple Tasks.

data.name: WCTAnalyzerDescription
data.value: This Tasks uses Synchronization Mechanisms. Be sure to not introduce Deadlocks or similiar hazards when working with multiple Tasks.
